title: 107_hr3285
content: The Act titled "Federal-Local Information Sharing Partnership Act of 2001" authorizes the sharing of grand jury information. Rule 6(e)(3)(C) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure is amended to allow sharing of grand jury information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. The amendment allows sharing of grand jury information with State or political subdivision law enforcement personnel, with guidelines for confidentiality. SEC. 3. AUTHORITY TO SHARE ELECTRONIC, WIRE, AND ORAL INTERCEPTION INFORMATION. Section 2517(6) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to allow sharing of interception information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. The amendment allows sharing interception information with State or political subdivision law enforcement personnel, with guidelines for confidentiality. SEC. 4. FOREIGN INTELLIGENCE INFORMATION. Section 203(d)(1) of the USA PATRIOT ACT is amended to allow sharing of information with state law enforcement personnel, removing the requirement for federal involvement. The USA PATRIOT ACT is amended to allow sharing of information with state law enforcement personnel, removing the federal requirement. State or political subdivision chief executive officers or law enforcement personnel must use the information in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 5. DISCLOSURES TO GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES FOR COUNTERTERRORISM PURPOSES. Section 626(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to allow disclosure of consumer report information to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision for official duties. Law enforcement personnel receiving consumer report information for official duties must use it in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 6. MULTILATERAL COOPERATION AGAINST TERRORISTS. Section 222(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow the Secretary of State to provide records related to visas or permits to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. The Secretary of State can provide visa or permit records to State law enforcement personnel if deemed necessary, with restrictions on how the information can be used. The subdivision of a State receiving information must use it in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 7 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition. SEC. 8 pertains to information acquired from physical searches. SEC. 8 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition from physical searches. Section 444(j)(1)(B) of the General Education Provisions Act is amended to allow disclosure of education records to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision for official duties. Amendment allows disclosure of education records to law enforcement personnel for official duties, with guidelines on information use. SEC. 10. INVESTIGATION AND PROSECUTION OF TERRORISM. Section 408(c)(1)(B) of the National Education Statistics Act of 1994 is amended to allow for the disclosure of reports, records, and information to law enforcement personnel for official duties. The amendment allows law enforcement personnel to receive information for official duties and must use it in accordance with guidelines.
